Header: Disease prevention and eradication programs be broadened
Content: President Maithripala Sirisena has emphasized that disease prevention and eradication programs should be broadened. He said this while attending as the Chief Guest of the inauguration ceremony of the College of Emergency Medical Physicians at the BMICH, Colombo. President Maithripala Sirisena said that they see insufficient measures implemented by police and the government sector to prevent accidents. The President commended the doctors for their commitment to emergency treatment even with difficulties. The College of Emergency Medical Physicians was launched in 2013 when he was the Health Minister. The College has conducted nearly 300 Workshops jointly with the hospitals in Singapore, Australia and other countries. The President presented medals to 11 Emergency Treatment Doctors in recognition of their services. The President opened the new website of the College.
